title: Code compiles faster on x64
body: <p>x64 iz teh r0x0r.  I've been following the <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/craigmcmurtry/" title="x64 is awesome">x64 goodness on Craig McMurtry's blog</a> lately.  Here's a quote from <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/craigmcmurtry/archive/2004/11/05/252858.aspx" title="64-bit Windows Part 4: The x64 Standard">one of his recent posts</a>: </p><blockquote>At Microsoft, I’m told that we’ve switched to using x64 machines to compile our Windows operating systems, and the effects have been stunning.  Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 1 took 9 hours to compile on x86 machines, but just 3 hours on x64s.  Longhorn took 18 hours to build on x86 machines, but just 6 hours on x64s!</blockquote><p>So code will compile in about <strong title="one third the time!!!">1/3 the time</strong> on an x64 processor.  I <em>really</em> wish Dell would start selling AMD stuff, those lousy luddites.</p>
